snippet: The ruling military council has appeared increasingly willing to use force without apology to intimidate its critics, including directing assaults on demonstrators.
abstract: Egypt's military-led government justifies its crackdown on human rights and democracy-building organizations as a defense against foreign interference, escalating a diplomatic feud with the United States; Egypt's defense of raids on nonprofit groups, most supported by the US, is latest indication that military rulers share ousted Pres Hosni Mubarak's dim view of human rights and democracy.
lead_paragraph: The ruling military council has appeared increasingly willing to use force without apology to intimidate its critics, including directing assaults on demonstrators.

headline.seo: Backing Off Vow of Softer Stance, Egypt Backs Office Raids
headline.main: Undercutting Vow of Softer Stance, Egypt Again Defends Office Raids
headline.print_headline: Undercutting Vow of Softer Stance, Egypt Again Defends Office Raids

keywords.value: Human Rights and Human Rights Violations
keywords.name: subject
